indexing.lsh

Class E2LSHIndex

  • java.lang.Object
    • indexing.lsh.E2LSHIndex
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Index

    public class E2LSHIndex
extends java.lang.Object
implements Index
    Implementation of a E2LSH index. Following the standard LSH procedure, each vector is quantized into hash indices as follows : For each table : - compute hash values hi(.) by projecting the vector on a random line, - compute the index as a concatenation of hi(.) values qj(.) = (h1(.), h2(.), ..., hk(.)), - store the vector on bucket qj(.) of the hashtable. Querying is performed by hashing the query vector and returning the matches in the corresponding buckets of each table. For the sake of efficiency, qj(.) elements are picked at random from a set of precomputed h(.) values, so the same hi(.) may be used in several qi(.) (but no more than once in each qj(.)). Data is stored in hashtables using q(.) as key. The hashing method for q(.) is borrowed from P. Indyk's implementation. The size of the actual hashtables has a impact on the efficiency of the index.
    Author:
    Pierre Tirilly - pierre.tirilly@imt-lille-douai.fr

    • Constructor Detail

      • E2LSHIndex

        public E2LSHIndex(int d,
                  int m,
                  int k,
                  int l,
                  int table_size,
                  float w)
        Creates a new E2LSH index.
        Parameters:
        d - Dimension of the data vectors to be indexed.
        m - Number of random projections h(.) used.
        k - Length of q(.) codes.
        l - Number of hashtables.
        table_size - Size of the actual hashtables storing the data.
        w - Quantization step.

        public void index(org.bytedeco.javacpp.opencv_core.MatVector collection)
        Description copied from interface: Index
        Stores the given image descriptors in the index. Data previously stored in the index is removed.
        Specified by:
        index in interface Index
        Parameters:
        collection - The descriptors to index. Each entry is a matrix containing image descriptors as rows.

      • knnQuery

        public org.bytedeco.javacpp.opencv_core.DMatchVectorVector knnQuery(org.bytedeco.javacpp.opencv_core.Mat query,
                                                                    int k)
        Description copied from interface: Index
        Performs a k-nearest neighbors query in the index.
        Specified by:
        knnQuery in interface Index
        Parameters:
        query - Query descriptors. Each matrix row is a descriptor.
        k - Number of nearest neighbors to retrieve for each query descriptor.
        Returns:
        Matches found in the index. Each entry is a match vector containing all the matches of the corresponding query vector. Returns null if no data is indexed or if the query is null.

      • epsQuery

        public org.bytedeco.javacpp.opencv_core.DMatchVectorVector epsQuery(org.bytedeco.javacpp.opencv_core.Mat query,
                                                                    float eps)
        Description copied from interface: Index
        Performs an epsilon-search query in the index.
        Specified by:
        epsQuery in interface Index
        Parameters:
        query - Query descriptors. Each matrix row is a descriptor.
        eps - Radius of the search.
        Returns:
        Matches found in the index, i.e. descriptors within the specified radius for each query. Each entry is a match vector containing all the matches of the corresponding query vector. Returns null if no data is indexed or if the query is null.
